summary.overall_findings: Coca-Cola's public disclosures address responsible AI practices at both operational and policy levels across all 7 evaluated pillars. For governance, published materials outline mandatory considerations for AI implementation and discuss data matching and vendor data usage for insights. Policy-level documentation further addresses areas such as fairness, with guidelines to avoid social biases for AI pilots, and privacy, describing data use for profiling and data sharing controls. Additionally, disclosures for external accountability mandate vendor audits and reporting on violations. These findings are drawn from 35 publicly available sources.
